name: pueraria-montana-var-lobata
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
fruit-description: Flattened pods 1.5 to 3 inches long. They mature from September to January and are produced only on climbing vines.
flower-description: Pea-like pink or purplish flowers 0.8 to 1 inch long appear in axillary racemes that reach 4 to 8 inches long. It flowers from June to September.
leaf-description: Pinnately compound three leaflets, alternate grayish green or yellow 2 to 8 inches long
stem-description: The long flexible stems are used in basket making.
uses: The long flexible stems are used in basket making.  Powder from the root is used in making Arrowroot tea which is popular medicine in China, Japan, and Korea.  It is being studied for its medicinal properties.
